intro: Winklera afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. Winklera afghanica is often found at high altitudes, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
